instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the identification of different varieties of chrysanthemum and how far can this metric go in the research?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the identification in this research is the accuracy rate. The accuracy rate measures the percentage of correct identifications made by the model. 

In this study, the accuracy rates in the calibration sets for the four chrysanthemum varieties (Boju, Chuju, Hangju, and Gongju) were reported as 100%, 100%, 98.65%, and 96.67% respectively. In the prediction sets, the accuracy rates were reported as 100% for all varieties except for Hangju, which had an accuracy rate of 99.1%.

The accuracy rate is a commonly used metric to assess the performance of classification models. It provides a measure of how well the model is able to correctly identify the different chrysanthemum varieties based on the near infrared diffuses reflectance spectra.

However, it is important to note that the accuracy rate alone does not provide a complete picture of the model's performance. Other metrics such as precision, recall, and F1 score could also be considered to evaluate the model's performance in identifying the chrysanthemum varieties accurately.

instruction: How were the machine learning models utilized in the development of a rapid and noninvasive method for identifying different varieties of chrysanthemum using near infrared spectroscopy?
Output: The machine learning models were utilized in the development of a rapid and noninvasive method for identifying different varieties of chrysanthemum using near infrared spectroscopy by building a model with partial least squares (PLS). The near infrared diffuses reflectance spectra of chrysanthemum varieties were preprocessed using first order derivative (D1) and autoscaling. The calibration set, consisting of 160 batches of chrysanthemum samples, was used to train the model. The prediction set, consisting of 84 batches of chrysanthemum samples, was used to test the accuracy of the model. The accuracy rates of the machine learning model in identifying the chrysanthemum varieties were reported for both the calibration set and the prediction set. The results showed high accuracy rates for the identification of different chrysanthemum varieties using this method.
